title: Legal Office Administration
headline: This free online course explains the various practices required to work in administration in a legal practice.
description: This course teaches you how to perform the various procedures and functions of the legal profession. We take you through the preparation of legal documents, litigation and contracts as we explore various types of law, including its criminal, family, business, real estate and bankruptcy applications. Sign up for this short course to master the incredibly useful tools you can use in the legal field while you advance your career.

Discuss estate planning and guardianship with elderly clients

courseDescription:
This course covers everything you need to know to work in various legal settings. We explain certification for paralegals, including the American National Association of Legal Assistant (NALA) certification, the National Federation of Paralegals Association (NFPA) certification and National Association of Legal Assistants (NALA) certification. We then go through the preparation of legal documents and explore the workings of a legal office in terms of billing, litigation and contracts.

We examine the dynamics of criminal law and procedure, including torts, felonies and misdemeanors. The course then investigates family law in terms of marriage, divorce and child custody before delving into business law and topics like sole proprietorship and financial partnerships. We also study real estate laws concerning mortgages, deeds and basic ownership rights.

The course then moves on to elder law governing various types of will, estate planning and guardianship. We conclude with bankruptcy and show you how to file a ‘Chapter Seven’ case as we compare dischargeable and non-dischargeable debt. This course benefits aspiring legal students and anyone interested in learning about important legal procedures and file management to perform effective legal office administration. If you are an aspiring paralegal or legal assistant, we can help you take that next step towards your dream.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Certification for Paralegals, students will learn about preparation for certification and the examination for certification. As well as the exam format. They will also learn about NALA Certification, NAFP Certification, and NALS Certification. It will also cover the difference between a paralegal and legal Assistant?

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, The Law Office, students will learn about ethical considerations. As well as client relations. They will also learn about dealing with mail. It will also cover file management. Students will learn the use of technology for the law office and skills that every legal secretary should have.
topics: Topic G - Skills that Every Legal Secretary Should Have

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Billing, students will learn all about how attorneys charge. This course will also cover factors that impact an attorney’s fee. Students will gain an understanding time and cost entries as well as billing. How trust accounts work. Students will also learn about docket administration.
topics: Topic B - Time and Cost Entries

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Preparing Legal Documents, students will learn all about the basic preparation of legal documents and how to begin the case. It will break down the title, the body, signature and COS. It will also cover legal citations. Students will also learn about the law library and legal research for a case.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Litigation, students will learn all about what litigation is. This module will also cover opening the file and the delivery of documents. It will also go into additional pleadings. As well as what discovery is. Students will also learn all about motions prior to as well as during trial.
topics: Topic C - Motions Prior to and During Trial

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Contracts, students will learn about the basics or contracts. Students will also learn about the essential elements. As well as remedies for breach of contract. Including information on general damages, consequential damages, and reliance damages as well as the differences between them.
topics: Topic C - Remedies for Breach of Contract

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Torts, students will learn about the goal of tort law and the basic of tort law. As well as topics such as negligence. Students will also learn about the 3 main types of torts. As well as intentional torts and intentional infliction of emotional distress. It will also cover injunctive relief and strict liability.
topics: Topic A - The Goal of Tort Law

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Criminal Law and Procedure, students will learn about Criminal Law Basics. Students will gain an understanding of misdemeanors and felonies. They will also learn definitions of some common crimes. As well as criminal procedure and some of the defenses a defendant may use. It will also cover the 4th, 5th and 6th amendments.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Family Law, students will learn about marriage and the premarital agreement. It will also cover annulment and divorce including no fault divorce. Students will also learn about child custody and support agreements. It will also cover the attorney’s role in a divorce. The module will also touch on uniform laws.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Business Law, students will learn about types of organizations. It will also cover sole proprietorship and the sole proprietor. As well as partnerships and limited liability partnerships. Students will also learn about corporations. The module will also cover limited liability companies.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Real Estate, students will learn about the basics of real estate and ownership rights. Students will also learn about 4 methods of acquiring property. This module will also cover types of concurrent ownership. As well as deeds. It will also go into detail on mortgages. It will also go into detail on documenting transactions.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Estate Planning and Guardianship, students will learn about estate plan documents. This module will as go into detail on types of trusts and funding, as well as elements of a Trust. Students will also learn about elder law and types of wills. It will also discuss Guardianship and conservatorships.
topics: Topic B - Characteristics of a Will
Topic C - Types of Trusts and Funding

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Bankruptcy, students will learn about filing a chapter 7 case. They will also learn about means testing. The module will also go into detail about the automatic stay and 341 meeting. It will also cover chapter 11 and chapter 13 cases. Students will also learn about dischargeable and Non-dischargeable debt.
